entries.title: Marketing Qualified Lead
entries.definition:
A lead that has been deemed more likely to become a customer based on marketing engagement metrics and lead intelligence.

MQLs have typically:

  • Engaged with marketing content
  • Met lead scoring thresholds
  • Shown buying intent signals

entries.title: Sales Qualified Lead
entries.definition:
A prospective customer that has been researched and vetted by both marketing and sales teams and is deemed ready for the next stage in the sales process.

SQLs are characterized by:

  • Clear budget and authority
  • Defined need and timeline
  • Active engagement with sales

entries.title: Customer Relationship Management
entries.definition: A technology for managing all your company's relationships and interactions with customers and potential customers. HubSpot CRM is the central database where all contact, company, deal, and ticket information is stored.

entries.title: Lifecycle Stage
entries.definition:
A property that indicates where a contact or company is in your marketing and sales funnel. Default stages include:

  • Subscriber - Opted in to hear from you
  • Lead - Converted on your site
  • MQL - Marketing qualified
  • SQL - Sales qualified
  • Opportunity - Associated with a deal
  • Customer - Closed won deal
  • Evangelist - Promoter of your brand

entries.title: Deal Pipeline
entries.definition:
A visual representation of where deals are in your sales process. Pipelines contain stages that represent milestones in your sales cycle.

Each pipeline stage typically has:

  • A name describing the milestone
  • A probability percentage
  • Required properties to advance

entries.title: HubSpot Owner
entries.definition: The user in HubSpot assigned responsibility for a specific contact, company, deal, or ticket. Owners can be assigned manually or automatically through workflows and lead routing rules.

entries.title: Associated Records
entries.definition: The connections between different objects in HubSpot CRM. For example, a contact can be associated with a company, deals, and tickets. Associations help maintain a complete picture of customer relationships.

entries.title: Property
entries.definition: A field that stores information about a record in HubSpot. Properties can be default (created by HubSpot) or custom (created by your team). Types include single-line text, dropdown, date, number, and more.

entries.title: Workflow
entries.definition:
An automated series of actions that execute when specific criteria are met. Workflows can:

  • Send emails automatically
  • Update record properties
  • Create tasks and notifications
  • Rotate leads to owners
  • Trigger webhooks and integrations

entries.title: List
entries.definition:
A segmented group of records based on property values or behaviors. HubSpot has two types:

  • Active Lists - Automatically update as records meet or no longer meet criteria
  • Static Lists - Fixed membership, records must be manually added/removed

entries.title: Form
entries.definition: A data collection tool that captures visitor information and creates or updates records in HubSpot. Forms can be embedded on websites, landing pages, or shared via direct links.

entries.title: Landing Page
entries.definition: A standalone web page created specifically for marketing or advertising campaigns. Landing pages are designed with a single focused objective, typically to capture leads through a form submission.

entries.title: Call-to-Action
entries.definition: A button or link that prompts visitors to take a specific action, such as downloading content, signing up for a demo, or making a purchase. CTAs are tracked in HubSpot for conversion analytics.

entries.title: Lead Scoring
entries.definition: A methodology for ranking leads based on their perceived value to the organization. HubSpot Score is calculated using positive and negative attributes including demographic fit and engagement behaviors.

entries.title: Activity Timeline
entries.definition: The chronological history of all interactions and changes on a record. The timeline shows emails, calls, meetings, notes, tasks, form submissions, page views, and property changes.
